wwoorrkk aatt tthhee eenndd ooff eevveerryy rrooww -- tthhee ssttaarrttiinngg cchhaaiinn aatt tthhee bbeeggiinnnniinngg ooff rrooww ddooeess nnoott ccoouunntt aass aa sstt -- iinnccrreeaassee // ddeeccrreeaassee tthhee ssttaarrttiinngg cchhaaiinn ffoorr aa wwiiddeerr // ttiigghhtteerr bbllaannkkeett -- iinnccrreeaassee // ddeeccrreeaassee tthhee nnuummbbeerr ooff rroowwss ffoorr aa lloonnggeerr // sshhoorrtteerr bbllaannkkeett -- rreemmeemmbbeerr tthhaatt iiff yyoouu ddeecciiddee ttoo cchhaannggee tthhee yyaarrnn wweeiigghhtt aanndd tthhee hhooookk ssiizzee tthhee ssccaarrff slip_stitch mmeeaassuurreemmeennttss wwiillll vvaarryy aaccccoorrddiinnggllyy -- rreemmeemmbbeerr ttoo ccoouunntt tthhee ssiinnggllee ccrroocchheett rroowwss aanndd nnoott jjuusstt tthhee ddoouubbllee ccrroocchheett rroowwss gauge 9 double_crochet = 10 cm 4 inches gauge is fundamental for this project if you want to match the given measurement so please check the gauge before starting your work if your gauge is tighter size your hook up to create looser gauge and bigger gauge to match the given measurements if your gauge is looser size your hook down to create tighter gauge and a smaller gauge finished measurements width = 75 cm 29 5 inches length = 95 cm 37 4 inches abbreviations us terminology chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = doudle crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch repeat = repeat st s = stitch es r = row round = round ya = yarn a yb = yarn b sm s = stitch marker s the pattern and photographs contained in these pages are property of thewoolenrose this pattern is available for personal use only no unauthorized reproduction in whole or in part or distribution of this pattern or content is allowed 2 special technique instructions how to make a pompom you need 1 pencil / pen scissors paper / card board 1 cap 1 coin place the cap on the surface of the card board and trace 2 circles cut the 2 circles you have 2 identical circles place the coin in the centre of the circle and trace in cut out the smaller circle from the larger one do the same with the other circle line them up and cut a larger exit row line the 2 circles perfectly and start wrapping the yarn all around the circles the more yarn you wrap the more the pompom will be fluffy do not pull tightly the pattern and photographs contained in these pages are property of thewoolenrose this pattern is available for personal use only no unauthorized reproduction in whole
